entry.title: Bitcoin Open Interest Decline Mirrors 2021 Drop, Is History About To Repeat?
entry.summary:
Bitcoin‚Äôs recent price swings seem to have sparked a wave of uncertainty among retail and institutional investors as its Open Interest (OI) has witnessed a significant decline in light of several negative factors hindering the market, such as macroeconomic turbulence.
Is Bitcoin Poised For A 2021-Style Performance?
In a pessimistic development, the open interest in Bitcoin has dropped sharply lately, mirroring a dip that was experienced in 2021. Alphractal, an advanced investment data analysis firm, reported the negative trend in the key on-chain metric on the X (formerly Twitter) platform, which reflects a period of caution or consolidation.
This decline in open interest, a metric that counts the total number of derivative contracts such as futures or options, might imply that tra‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum Founder Buterin Lays Out Possible Futures For ETH Protocol
entry.summary:
In a blog post released on October 14, Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin outlined potential future enhancements for the Ethereum protocol, focusing on technical improvements to its proof-of-stake (PoS) system. Titled ‚ÄúPossible futures of the Ethereum protocol, part 1: The Merge,‚Äù the post delves into strategies to improve stability, performance, and accessibility while addressing centralization risks.
First, Buterin reflects on Ethereum‚Äôs successful transition from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake aka ‚ÄúThe Merge‚Äù nearly two years ago, noting that ‚Äúthis proof of stake has performed remarkably well in stability, performance and avoiding centralization risks.‚Äù However, he emphasized that ‚Äúthere still remain some important areas in which proof of stake needs to improve.‚Äù
Future Enhancemen‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hoskinson Details Cardano‚Äôs Bill Of Rights For Blockchain Governance
entry.summary:
Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, unveiled a framework for blockchain governance in his latest broadcast, introducing what he refers to as a ‚ÄúBill of Rights‚Äù for the Cardano ecosystem. This initiative, centered around 11 foundational blockchain tenants, aims to establish a constitutional foundation that will guide the development and governance of Cardano and potentially influence broader blockchain technologies.
Broadcasting live from Colorado on October 13, 2024, Hoskinson emphasized the collaborative efforts underpinning this initiative. ‚ÄúMore than 50 workshops have already been held,‚Äù he stated. The process has seen participation from 1,400 individuals and the election of 63 delegates.
At the heart of Hoskinson‚Äôs announcement is a blog post titled ‚ÄúThe 11 Blockchain Tenant‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple CEO Drops Bombshell, Accuses ‚ÄòRenegade‚Äô SEC Of Breaking The Rules
entry.summary:
If you think the four-year rift between Ripple Labs and the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is over, think again. In a series of X (Twitter) posts, Ripple executives shared their frustrations with the SEC after it ignored the court‚Äôs recent decision on XRP.
Despite a recent court ruling, Ripple‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, challenges the agency‚Äôs continued claim that XRP is a security. Brad Garlinghouse, Ripple‚Äôs CEO, has joined the chorus, calling the SEC ‚Äúa renegade agency.‚Äù
Ripple‚Äôs troubles with the SEC has a long history. Ripple was launched in 2012 and caught the industry‚Äôs attention in such a short time. By 2013, the company rebranded to Ripple Labs and soon partnered with Germany‚Äôs Fidor Bank. Ripple‚Äôs decentralization and unique consensus mechanism val‚Ä¶

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 205 - ALTCOINS CONTINUE TO RALLY!
entry.summary: SUI leads L1 gains as TVL crosses $1bn. Altcoin market cap close to breaking downtrend. SEI becomes top chain for 1 month TVL growth. ETH ETFs sees 3rd largest inflow ever. SEC delays ETH ETF options decision. SOL took most of ETH outflows over last 3 months. SOLETH continues to be trading at resistance. $8.1bn BTC options to expire this week. BTC heading to $500k-$1m in a year: PlanB. Stablecoin supply hits new ATH. Caroline Ellison sentenced to 2 years in jail. SBF & Diddy in the same jail. SEC settles against TUSD for not being collateralised. Gensler gets derided for crypto approach. Hester Pierce admits flaws in SEC crypto policy. Harris against regulation by litigation: Cuban. Golem claims ETH move to CEXs due to staking. Binance refutes data leak claims. Next Y combinator batch has ‚Äòno crypto companies‚Äô. Celo overtakes Tron for stablecoin addresses.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 204 - MOODENG MOO-NING!
entry.summary: BTC needs to top $65.2k to put in a higher high. ETH ETFs see biggest outflow since July. ETH outperformance could be start of ‚Äòalt season‚Äô. BlackRock gets 12hr BTC withdrawal from Coinbase. cbBTC only wrapped BTC to not show reserves. Telegram to share user data upon legal requests. EIGEN non-transferability to be removed Sep 30th. TIA announces $100m funding round. TIA deal was OTC token sale ‚Äòdone months ago‚Äô. Polymarket considers token, trying $50m raise. Maybe we will pay off debt with crypto: Trump. Harris unlikely to give full crypto policy pre-election. 13m Binance users‚Äô data may have been leaked. Caroline Ellison likely won‚Äôt serve time in jail.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 203 - KAMALA GOES PRO-CRYPTO
entry.summary: Crypto funds saw $321m inflows last week. Kamala commits to crypto & AI expansion. TAO leads gains in AI hype, does 2x in 2 weeks. SUI TVL breaks $900m. Average Q4 returns for BTC is 88%. BTC Google searches down 75% since 2021. BTC 161 days from halving, when it rallied in 2020. Crypto VCs raised $2.2bn this year, well below 2021.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 202 - SOL STARTS TO SEND IT
entry.summary: SOL leads majors as Breakpoint begins. SOL launches Frankendancer on mainnet. Helio Pay allows Shopify items to sell on X. Franklin Templeton to launch fund on SOL. BTC short term holders fall at fastest rate in 12 years. MicroStrategy upsizes convertible note raise to $1bn. BingX loses $52m in hack. $243m crypto heist exposed by ZachXBT. Supreme Court of India hacked on X, shills scam. SocGen launches Euro stablecoin on SOL. Sky agrees to stop using WBTC. Germany shuts down 47 crypto exchanges. Stablecoin‚Äôs now 18th biggest holder of treasuries. Consensys lawsuit against SEC dismissed. Partisanship will stop Trump crypto plans: Hoskinson. Scaramucci working with Kamala on crypto.
